physical_examinations.vital_signs: Albumin level: 26 g/L; Platelet count: 64 x 10^9 cells/L; Prothrombin international normalized ratio: 1.4
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe abdominal pain; Biopsy-proven cirrhosis; Ascites; Grade-2 esophageal varices; Lower extremity edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After treatment with intravenous heparin, abdominal pain and mesenteric venous thrombus resolved; portal venous thrombus recanalized. Six months after starting warfarin therapy, ascites and lower extremity edema disappeared.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Albumin level: 41 g/L; Alkaline phosphatase level: 94 kat/L; ALT level: 32 U/L; Bilirubin level: 13.7 μmol/L (0.8 mg/dL); Platelet count: 157 x 10^9 cells/L.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient has been well for 7 years and is still receiving warfarin.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient has improved markedly after treatment with warfarin.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Albumin level increased from 30 g/L to 38 g/L after starting warfarin therapy; patient has been well for 3 years.
